Region: Yorkshire and the Humber
ONS Code: E06000012
Lat: 53.54635583
Long: -0.135636713
Other Authorities: North Lincolnshire Council, North East Lincolnshire Council
Type: Housing

There is an agreed and shared allocation policy across all partners and as lead authority, North East Lincolnshire maintains the housing register for both Councils
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: https://www.homechoicelincs.org.uk/Data/ASPPages/1/38.aspx

Code: 159
Partnership Name: WYLAW - West Yorkshire legal services
Council Name: Bradford Metropolitan District Council
Region: Yorkshire and the Humber
ONS Code: E08000032
Lat: 53.84446279
Long: -1.853175174
Other Authorities: Bradford Metropolitan District, Calderdale Council, Kirklees Council, Leeds City Council, Wakefield Council
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: Five West Yorkshire authorities have started sharing legal services, with aims that include reducing external fees and agreeing a shared costs draftsman. This has also involved the development of a 'virtual reality pool' to tackle capacity gaps in ICT, advocacy & employment, and establishing an electronic hub to share information/data across the five participating authorities. Through setting up a Yorkshire consortium for library and research resources they estimate savings of up to 35%. A future aim is to more towards a single case management system.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Clare Millington, Clare.millington@leeds.gov.uk
Placemarker: ltblu_stars
Count:
col17:

Code: 243
Partnership Name: Coventry, Solihull and Warwickshire Sub-regional shared services
Council Name: Coventry City Council
Region: West Midlands
ONS Code: E08000026
Lat: 52.41648453
Long: -1.518283378
Other Authorities: Coventry City Council, Solihull metropolitan borough council and Warwickshire County Council
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: Coventry City Council, Solihull District Council and Warwickshire County Council have a long and established history of collaborating on joint commissioning and delivery of services, with over 70 examples differing in scale, size and complexity. These include shared highways maintenance, emergency planning & resilience, fostering, street sweeping, superfast broadband and waste disposal. They are also currently exploring partnerships across Internal Fostering placements, School improvement services, Assets & facilities management, Public Health, Transport and Fleet.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Gereint Stoneman, gereint.stoneman@coventry.gov.uk

Code: 410
Partnership Name: Parish Environmental Teams
Council Name: Telford and Wrekin Council
Region: West Midlands
ONS Code: E06000020
Lat: 52.73511044
Long: -2.489324771
Other Authorities: To date 7 Parish Councils are part of the partnership. We hope this will increase in the future.
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: Telford and Wrekin Councils Public Realm Team have created a innovative programme (Parish Environmental Teams) that enhances & protects standards and jobs whilst still offering Council savings. The scheme in conjunction with Town and Parish Councils gives greater local control of service provision to members of the public, creates Apprenticeships and offers corporate savings. Providing a sustainable approach to managing services in the future, through promoting Partnerships, and giving Young People the skill they require to develop in this age of Austerity.
Savings: 1100000
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided

Placemarker: red_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: New for 2015
Code: 514
Partnership Name: Bromsgrove District and Redditch Borough Council
Council Name: Bromsgrove District Council
Region: West Midlands
ONS Code: E07000234
Lat: 52.36136876
Long: -2.014592673
Other Authorities: Bromsgrove District Council Redditch Borough Council
Type: Shared Management and Shared CEX
Description: Bromsgrove District and Redditch Borough Councils began sharing its services in 2010, with a shared Chief Executive and Management team, since then, the majority of remaining services have been shared from management to front line services. The annual saving for both authorities is 2.75 million. During this transition we have also been implementing a Transformation programme throughout. The customer is at the heart of everything we do and we have established good relationships and will continue to work with partners accross Worcestershire to understand what matters to our citizens and provide the best possible service we can. An example of our improved service, is that originally if a citizen of Redditch presented with a housing need, they went on the housing list and would, if suitable have an appointment with a housing officer within a few weeks. Currently, if a citizen of Redditch presents they meet with a housing officer, their needs are understood and options are explored, including our housing stock, private rented, moving in with family, social housing etc. This way of working removes a lot of waste from our processes so is more valuable in terms of how our organisation works and also far more beneficial to our customers.
Savings: 8250000
Status: Operational
Website: http://www.bromsgrove.gov.uk/ http://www.redditch.whub.org.uk/
Contact: h.mole@bromsgroveandredditch.gov.uk
Placemarker: ylw_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: New for 2015

Lat: 52.28189307
Long: -1.950433482
Other Authorities: Bromsgrove District Council Redditch Borough Council
Type: Shared Management and Shared CEX
Description: Bromsgrove District and Redditch Borough Councils began sharing its services in 2010, with a shared Chief Executive and Management team, since then, the majority of remaining services have been shared from management to front line services. The annual saving for both authorities is 2.75 million. During this transition we have also been implementing a Transformation programme throughout. The customer is at the heart of everything we do and we have established good relationships and will continue to work with partners accross Worcestershire to understand what matters to our citizens and provide the best possible service we can. An example of our improved service, is that originally if a citizen of Redditch presented with a housing need, they went on the housing list and would, if suitable have an appointment with a housing officer within a few weeks. Currently, if a citizen of Redditch presents they meet with a housing officer, their needs are understood and options are explored, including our housing stock, private rented, moving in with family, social housing etc. This way of working removes a lot of waste from our processes so is more valuable in terms of how our organisation works and also far more beneficial to our customers.
Savings: 8250000
Status: Operational
Website: http://www.bromsgrove.gov.uk/ http://www.redditch.whub.org.uk/

Type: Shared Services - Back office

The primary purpose of the joint team is to increase resilience (including in the Land Charges function), improve the quality and broaden the range of services provided, increase income earning opportunities and reduce external legal expenditure across the three Councils.

Description: The councils have been developing shared services since the introduction of a shared Chief Executive in 2007 and now have shared Senior Management Team with shared arrangements in the following areas Assets, Environment Services, Corporate Services, Finance and Audit, ICT and Customer Services, Environmental Health and Housing, and Planning, Economy and Community.
Savings: 4000000
Status: Operational
Website: http://www.southhams.gov.uk/index/council_index/ksppressofficeindex/specpressreleases.htm?newsid=33720
Contact: Richard Sheard, South West Devon Council, richard.sheard@swdevon.gov.uk

Code: 169
Partnership Name: DELT Services
Council Name: Plymouth City Council
Region: South West
ONS Code: E06000026
Lat: 50.3911953
Long: -4.118816464
Other Authorities: Plymouth City Council (PCC) and NHS Northern, Eastern and Western (NEW) Devon Clinical Commissioning Group
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: Delt Shared Services Ltd launched on 1st October 2014 and is a publicly owned private sector company. The company started with two partners, Plymouth City Council (PCC) and NHS Northern, Eastern and Western (NEW) Devon Clinical Commissioning Group who between them, provide services for over 900,000 people. Delt will initially deliver ICT services and systems to its partners. Delt will build a technological base within the South West of England and grow local talent by employing apprentices and recruiting, where possible, from local universities. Management expertise and systems will be shared and jobs, expertise and infrastructure will remain local. It will look to deliver effective outcomes for citizens and local communities through flexible, knowledgeable and trusted services. The limited company is guaranteed by shares and will be governed under Teckal exemptions. This means in the future that other public sector partners can join the company without the need for expensive procurement processes.
Savings: 1000000
Status: Operational
Website: WWW.DELTSERVICES.CO.UK
Contact: JUDITH SMITH, SENIOR EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT JUDITH.SMITH@DELTSERVICES.CO.UK
Placemarker: ltblu_stars
Count:

Code: 42
Partnership Name: SE7 Collaboration
Council Name: Brighton & Hove City Council
Region: South East
ONS Code: E06000043
Lat: 50.83661041
Long: -0.131521555
Other Authorities: Brighton & Hove City Council, East Sussex County Council, Hampshire County Council, Kent County Council, Medway Council, Surrey County Council, West Sussex County Council
Type: Procurement and Capital Assets
Description: The SE7 operates under two overarching principles drive all activity for the partnership: � The SE7 councils work collaboratively to provide quality, value for money services while exploring opportunities to deliver improvements for our residents, communities and businesses; and � The SE7 is a motivated, business-like partnership, with a proven track record, that is committed to working with Government and partners to deliver real change and cost effective ways of working, particularly in light of the anticipated financial context to 2020. The partnership is delivering its aims through a focus on: highways construction and maintenance, waste management, information technology, property asset management and procurement. In addition to the financial benefits delivered to date, it is anticipated that a further �20m of benefits will be realised over the next three years.
Savings: 24000000
Status: Operational
Website: http://www.eastsussex.gov.uk/yourcouncil/about/committees/meetingpapers/cabinet/2014/11november.htm
Contact: lee.banner@eastsussex.gov.uk
Placemarker: purple_stars

Description: The SE7 operates under two overarching principles drive all activity for the partnership: � The SE7 councils work collaboratively to provide quality, value for money services while exploring opportunities to deliver improvements for our residents, communities and businesses; and � The SE7 is a motivated, business-like partnership, with a proven track record, that is committed to working with Government and partners to deliver real change and cost effective ways of working, particularly in light of the anticipated financial context to 2020. The partnership is delivering its aims through a focus on: highways construction and maintenance, waste management, information technology, property asset management and procurement. In addition to the financial benefits delivered to date, it is anticipated that a further �20m of benefits will be realised over the next three years.

Status: Operational

Contact: lee.banner@eastsussex.gov.uk
Placemarker: purple_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: Updated for 2015
Code: 42
Partnership Name: SE7 Collaboration
Council Name: Hampshire County Council
Region: South East
ONS Code: E10000014
Lat: 51.05850475
Long: -1.282286847
Other Authorities: Brighton & Hove City Council, East Sussex County Council, Hampshire County Council, Kent County Council, Medway Council, Surrey County Council, West Sussex County Council
Type: Procurement and Capital Assets
Description: The SE7 operates under two overarching principles drive all activity for the partnership: � The SE7 councils work collaboratively to provide quality, value for money services while exploring opportunities to deliver improvements for our residents, communities and businesses; and � The SE7 is a motivated, business-like partnership, with a proven track record, that is committed to working with Government and partners to deliver real change and cost effective ways of working, particularly in light of the anticipated financial context to 2020. The partnership is delivering its aims through a focus on: highways construction and maintenance, waste management, information technology, property asset management and procurement. In addition to the financial benefits delivered to date, it is anticipated that a further �20m of benefits will be realised over the next three years.
Savings: 24000000
Status: Operational
Website: http://www.eastsussex.gov.uk/yourcouncil/about/committees/meetingpapers/cabinet/2014/11november.htm
Contact: lee.banner@eastsussex.gov.uk

Partnership Name: South Thames Gateway Building Control Partnership

Region: South East
ONS Code: E07000109
Lat: 51.41006323
Long: 0.398645529
Other Authorities: Swale Borough Council, Gravesham Borough Councils, Medway Council
Type: Shared Services - Customer Facing
Description: Amalgamated building control service started on 1st October 2007. Assessments have shown that the joint service has given rise to greater savings than could have been secured should the 3 Authorities have maintained their separate services. Savings have broadly matched the significant downturn in fees.
Savings: 500000

Code: 149
Partnership Name: East Hampshire District Council, Havant Borough Council and Hampshire County Council. IT Shared Infrastructure
Council Name: East Hampshire District Council
Region: South East
ONS Code: E07000085
Lat: 51.07662647
Long: -0.958165165
Other Authorities: East Hampshire District Council, Hampshire County Council, Havant Borough Council
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: East Hampshire District Council and Havant Borough Council have created a virtual unitary council by entering a partnership delivering IT services with Hampshire County Council. This is underpinned by a single shared IT infrastructure delivering, from HCC's data centre, a common desktop, mobile services, helpdesk services, support and maintenance. Individial application specialists are retained by East Hants and Havant councils.
Savings: 300000

Code: 152
Partnership Name: The Hampshire Public Services Network (HPSN2)
Council Name: Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council
Region: South East
ONS Code: E07000084
Lat: 51.2702653
Long: -1.201714311
Other Authorities: Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council; East Hants District Council; Eastleigh Borough Council; Fareham Borough Council; Gosport Borough Council; Hampshire County Council; Hampshire Fire and Rescue Service; Hart District Council; Havant Borough Council; Isle of Wight Council
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: The HPSN2 is now in its 15th year and its 2nd generation. It supports all the boroughs, unitaries, districts and County Council schools, Fire & Rescue and others. It operating on a truly co-operative model of sharing, capable of delivering a range of services including voice, data, mobile, PSN, disaster recovery, CCTV and Internet to all participants.
Savings: 400000
Status: Operational
Website: http://www3.hants.gov.uk/hpsn2.htm
Contact: jane.stedman@hants.gov.uk

Code: 203
Partnership Name: Chiltern and South Bucks District Council shared management
Council Name: Chiltern District Council
Region: South East
ONS Code: E07000005
Lat: 51.67921023
Long: -0.630774219
Other Authorities: Chiltern District Council and South Bucks District Council
Type: Shared Management and Shared CEX
Description: The two District Councils have a single senior management arrangement comprising shared Chief Executive, share Directors, and shared Heads of Service. This partnership aimed to reduce costs in response to ongoing financial pressures facing both councils. These savings have led to better value for money, reduced costs for Council Tax payers, increased resilience and better co-operation. The next phase will look at shared service delivery for further efficiencies.
Savings: 660000

Code: 319
Partnership Name: Benefit Fraud Arrangement
Council Name: Gravesham Borough Council
Region: South East
ONS Code: E07000109
Lat: 51.40721432
Long: 0.392121238
Other Authorities: Gravesham Council and Tonbridge Malling Borough Council
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: The Investigations Manager employed by Gravesham Borough Council is shared by the two partners on a 50:50 basis. Benefits are: Reduced cost of the Benefit Investigation Service to each council. Increased resilience across the two Benefit Investigation Teams. Increased investigation efficiency through adoption of best working practices and sharing of investigation resources. Where practical, consistent counter-fraud arrangements between both authorities.
Savings: 115000
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Srah Parfitt, sarah.parfitt@gravesham.gov.uk

ONS Code: E06000043

Originally formed to procure a PSN to deliver cheaper, secure connections to each organisation, LINK has now formed cross sector intelligent client functions covering all of the public sector in Sussex.

Type: With other public sector organisations
Description: The partnership aims to realise �30m Capital Receipts, �10m reduction in revenue and a 20% reduction in CO2 emissions via co-location and collaboration over 10 years. Further benefits are expected from co-location of related services, co-location of response services and collabroating on customer contact activity.

Long: -1.199470559

Type: With other public sector organisations
Description: The partnership aims to realise �30m Capital Receipts, �10m reduction in revenue and a 20% reduction in CO2 emissions via co-location and collaboration over 10 years. Further benefits are expected from co-location of related services, co-location of response services and collabroating on customer contact activity.
Savings: 5969574
Status: Operational
Website: TBC
Contact: simone.cuthbert@eastsussex.gov.uk

Placemarker: ltblu_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: Updated for 2015
Code: 455
Partnership Name: The Link
Council Name: Ashford Borough Council
Region: South East
ONS Code: E07000105
Lat: 51.12472517
Long: 0.8129949
Other Authorities: Brighton and Hove City Council East Sussex County Council Eastbourne Borough Council Hastings District Council Lewes District Council Rother District Council Wealden District Council Sussex Police East Sussex Fire & Rescue NHS Brighton and Sussex University.
Type: Procurement and Capital Assets
Description: The LINK is a consortium for the joint procurement and operation of best value ICT services. It encourages the participation of all public services organisations in Sussex and the immediate proximity. Governed by its stakeholders and managed on their behalf by a Consortium Client team, the Link delivers cost savings through aggregation, sharing costs and driving better collaboration. Through its procured suppliers, the Link portfolio currently includes WAN, LAN and other network services, and Telephony, Contact Centre and Unified Communications services. Further services are planned to support stakeholder requirements.
Savings: 4000000
Status: Operational
Website: http://linksussex.org/
Contact: matt.scott@eastsussex.gov.uk
Placemarker: purple_stars
Count:
col17:

Update Status: Updated for 2015
Code: 455
Partnership Name: The Link
Council Name: Wealden District Council
Region: South East
ONS Code: E07000065
Lat: 50.96409329
Long: 0.1980331
Other Authorities: Brighton and Hove City Council East Sussex County Council Eastbourne Borough Council Hastings District Council Lewes District Council Rother District Council Wealden District Council Sussex Police East Sussex Fire & Rescue NHS Brighton and Sussex University.
Type: Procurement and Capital Assets
Description: The LINK is a consortium for the joint procurement and operation of best value ICT services. It encourages the participation of all public services organisations in Sussex and the immediate proximity. Governed by its stakeholders and managed on their behalf by a Consortium Client team, the Link delivers cost savings through aggregation, sharing costs and driving better collaboration. Through its procured suppliers, the Link portfolio currently includes WAN, LAN and other network services, and Telephony, Contact Centre and Unified Communications services. Further services are planned to support stakeholder requirements.
Savings: 4000000
Status: Operational
Website: http://linksussex.org/
Contact: matt.scott@eastsussex.gov.uk
Placemarker: purple_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: Not Updated for 2015
Code: 456
Partnership Name: Shared Environmental Service
Council Name: Cherwell District Council
Region: South East
ONS Code: E07000177
Lat: 51.96359242
Long: -1.276020617
Other Authorities: Cherwell District Council and South Northamptonshire Council
Type: Environment, Waste and Transport
Description: Cherwell District Council and South Northamptonshire Council are now sharing environmental services, reducing the number of senior managers and saving �200,000 a year. The new shared management structure follows the implementation of shared environmental services late last year, which included covered bring banks, bin deliveries, bulky waste and commercial waste.
Savings: 400000
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: No contact provided

Update Status: Updated for 2015
Code: 505
Partnership Name: Leading authority on itrent HR and Payroll system. Have agreement with Midland HR to allow purchase of system by other councils.
Council Name: Elmbridge Borough Council
Region: South East
ONS Code: E07000207
Lat: 51.35660914
Long: -0.390607571
Other Authorities: Epsom & Ewell, Mole Valley, Reigate & Banstead, Spelthorne, Waverley, Elmbridge with Tandridge leading IT and payroll shared service delivered by Epsom
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: Tandridge lead the partnership relationship with Midland HR, enabling shared operation and a single support mechanism to operate for the 7 partners. Tandridge have negotiated a partnership rate which benefits licence fees, upgrades and support arrangements, including a discounted consultancy rate. Sharing information and expertise leads to more rapid development, and overall costs have been reduced against the published commercial rates. Self service for the support of HR and Payroll has been increased across the authorities.
Savings: 60000
Status: Operational
Website: TBC
Contact: smitchenall@tandridge.gov.uk
Placemarker: ltblu_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: Updated for 2015

ONS Code: E07000212

Update Status: New for 2015
Code: 518
Partnership Name: H3 - Integrated Business Centre
Council Name: Hampshire Constabulary
Region: South East
ONS Code: Other
Lat: #N/A
Long: #N/A
Other Authorities: Hampshire Constabulary, Hamsphire County Council, Hamsphire Fire & Rescue Service
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: H3 is the first example of its type between such authorities in England, potentially delivering combined savings of up to �4 million each year. Savings will be used to lower organisational costs, increase flexibility and resilience, and protect frontline services. The services include: Integrated Business Centre; Finance; HR; Occupational Health and Wellbeing; Procurement; Print Services. This will all have a profound impact on organisational culture and working practices, becoming the centrepiece of any longer term shared services offering. The IBC will operate under a culture that is significantly different and more �commercial� than other functions in each organisation.
Savings: 2500000
Status: Operational
Website: http://www3.hants.gov.uk/hantswebnewslist.htm?id=625893
Contact: richard.white@hants.gov.uk
Placemarker: ltblu_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: New for 2015
Code: 518
Partnership Name: H3 - Integrated Business Centre
Council Name: Hampshire County Council
Region: South East
ONS Code: E10000014
Lat: 51.06325852
Long: -1.286275739
Other Authorities: Hampshire Constabulary, Hamsphire County Council, Hamsphire Fire & Rescue Service
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: H3 is the first example of its type between such authorities in England, potentially delivering combined savings of up to �4 million each year. Savings will be used to lower organisational costs, increase flexibility and resilience, and protect frontline services. The services include: Integrated Business Centre; Finance; HR; Occupational Health and Wellbeing; Procurement; Print Services. This will all have a profound impact on organisational culture and working practices, becoming the centrepiece of any longer term shared services offering. The IBC will operate under a culture that is significantly different and more �commercial� than other functions in each organisation.
Savings: 2500000

Update Status: New for 2015
Code: 518
Partnership Name: H3 - Integrated Business Centre
Council Name: Hamsphire Fire & Rescue Service
Region: South East
ONS Code: Other
Lat: #N/A
Long: #N/A
Other Authorities: Hampshire Constabulary, Hamsphire County Council, Hamsphire Fire & Rescue Service
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: H3 is the first example of its type between such authorities in England, potentially delivering combined savings of up to �4 million each year. Savings will be used to lower organisational costs, increase flexibility and resilience, and protect frontline services. The services include: Integrated Business Centre; Finance; HR; Occupational Health and Wellbeing; Procurement; Print Services. This will all have a profound impact on organisational culture and working practices, becoming the centrepiece of any longer term shared services offering. The IBC will operate under a culture that is significantly different and more �commercial� than other functions in each organisation.
Savings: 2500000
Status: Operational
Website: http://www3.hants.gov.uk/hantswebnewslist.htm?id=625893
Contact: richard.white@hants.gov.uk

ONS Code: E07000062

Type: Procurement and Capital Assets

Collectively we spend �60m+ on goods, services and works each year. The Hub was formed in 2010 and has created revenue and savings in excess of �8million. It also aims to create best practice across its members and make doing business with local government in East Sussex straightforward and more transparent. �8million in cashable savings or revenue generation and �2million in efficiency and added value to the end of March 2014
Savings: 8000000
Status: Operational

Code: 460
Partnership Name: Fresh & Balance (Tobacco and Alcohol Programme)
Council Name: Darlington Borough Council
Region: North East
ONS Code: E06000005
Lat: 54.54745594
Long: -1.55731961
Other Authorities: Darlington Borough Council, Durham County Council , Gateshead Council, Middlesbrough Council, Newcastle City Council, North Tyneside Council, Northumberland County Council, Redcar and Cleveland Borough Council, South Tyneside Council, Stockton Council, Sunderland City Council
Type: Adults
Description: DCC Lead Commissioner for Fresh & Balance (Tobacco and Alcohol Programme) This is the only regional tobacco and alcohol control office in the country. It is an example of good practice in coordinating advocacy, marketing, mass media, lobbying and intelligence reports on two of the most important public health issues.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: http://www.freshne.com/
Contact: CAS Public Health Mike Lavender, Mike.lavender@durham.gov.uk

Code: 462
Partnership Name: Regional Collaboration for NHS Complaints Advocacy
Council Name: Darlington Borough Council
Region: North East
ONS Code: E06000005
Lat: 54.54370539
Long: -1.555096842
Other Authorities: Gateshead lead, Darlington Borough Council , Durham County Council , Hartlepool Borough Council, Middlesbrough Council, Newcastle City Council, North Tyneside Council, Redcar and Cleveland Council, South Tyneside Council, Stockton Borough Council, Sunderland
Type: Adults
Description: Carers Federation have held the contract for the NHS Complaints Advocacy Service in the North East since 1 April 2013. The contract is a collaboration of 11 regional authorities led by Gateshead. The service provides information and advice and a direct advocacy service to people wishing to complain about NHS services they have received. A regional approach gives consistency of service to the user and provides savings to authorities through economies of scale.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: http://www.carersfederation.co.uk/services/independent-complaints-advocacy/locations/north-east-ica
Contact: Melanie MacDougall, Melanie.macdougall@durham.gov.uk
Placemarker: blu_stars
Count:
col17:

Placemarker: blu_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: Not Updated for 2015
Code: 464
Partnership Name: LA7 Young People and Skills Group (Pilot)
Council Name: Durham County Council
Region: North East
ONS Code: E06000047
Lat: 54.69417177
Long: -1.831677721
Other Authorities: 7 North East Local Authorities known as the LA7 which comprise:, Durham County Council, Gateshead Council, Newcastle City Council, North Tyneside Council Northumberland County Council, South Tyneside Council, Sunderland City Council, In addition, Connexions Tyne and Wear hub(delivering training) are involved in the steering group which is also inviting a teacher and an employer representative to work with the project, both as yet to be confirmed
Type: Children and Young People
Description: A pilot project to provide support and training for 14 schools across the region to improve CEIAG (Careers Education Information Advice and Guidance) and achieve a CEIAG Quality award validated by Careers England. The pilot schools to become established as CEIAG Champions, building capacity to support other schools to achieve the quality award, resulting in: embedding good practice, collaborative working and networking in CEIAG higher quality CEIAG across the region, improved outcomes/ participation rates post 16 improved Destination Measures for schools reductions in those young people who are not engaged in learning post 16(NEET)
Savings: 0
Status: In development
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Improving Progression of Young People Team - Linda Bailey/Judith Marshall, improvingprogression@durham.gov.uk
Placemarker: grn_blank
Count:
col17:
Update Status: Not Updated for 2015
Code: 464
Partnership Name: LA7 Young People and Skills Group (Pilot)
Council Name: Gateshead Council
Region: North East
ONS Code: E08000020
Lat: 54.93827592
Long: -1.676143654
Other Authorities: 7 North East Local Authorities known as the LA7 which comprise:, Durham County Council, Gateshead Council, Newcastle City Council, North Tyneside Council Northumberland County Council, South Tyneside Council, Sunderland City Council, In addition, Connexions Tyne and Wear hub(delivering training) are involved in the steering group which is also inviting a teacher and an employer representative to work with the project, both as yet to be confirmed
Type: Children and Young People
Description: A pilot project to provide support and training for 14 schools across the region to improve CEIAG (Careers Education Information Advice and Guidance) and achieve a CEIAG Quality award validated by Careers England. The pilot schools to become established as CEIAG Champions, building capacity to support other schools to achieve the quality award, resulting in: embedding good practice, collaborative working and networking in CEIAG higher quality CEIAG across the region, improved outcomes/ participation rates post 16 improved Destination Measures for schools reductions in those young people who are not engaged in learning post 16(NEET)
Savings: 0
Status: In development
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Improving Progression of Young People Team - Linda Bailey/Judith Marshall, improvingprogression@durham.gov.uk

Count:
col17:
Update Status: Not Updated for 2015
Code: 465
Partnership Name: LA7 Young People and Skills Group
Council Name: Durham County Council
Region: North East
ONS Code: E06000047
Lat: 54.69873741
Long: -1.832488366
Other Authorities: 7 North East Local Authorities known as the LA7 which comprise:, Durham County Council, Gateshead Council, Newcastle City Council, North Tyneside Council Northumberland County Council, South Tyneside Council, Sunderland City Council, Project led by Gateshead MBC
Type: Children and Young People
Description: ESF funded Youth Participation Project,"Engaging Vulnerable Young People" delivered across the NE Local Enterprise Partnership area. The project aims to reduce the number of young people not in education, employment or training. Lead partner Gateshead LA. The other 6 LAs, including Durham are strategic partners. 5 LAs (exception of Northumberland) are contracted to deliver wrap around support for young people. Engagement and training programmes are delivered across the Local Enterprise Partnership area by 70+ providers, 12 of whom are in Durham. All providers contract directly with Gateshead LA.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Improving Progression of Young People Team - Linda Bailey/Melanie Horner, improvingprogression@durham.gov.uk
Placemarker: grn_stars

Code: 467
Partnership Name: Community Equipment Service
Council Name: Darlington Borough Council
Region: North East
ONS Code: E06000005
Lat: 54.54381343
Long: -1.5470284
Other Authorities: Darlington Borough Council, Durham County Council, Darlington CCG, Durham Dales, Easington and Sedgefield CCG, North Durham CCG,
Type: Adults
Description: The current service is jointly funded and provides disability equipment to adults and children throughout County Durham and Darlington. Customers benefit from a more seamless service from a single provider and the funders benefit from the advantages of bulk purchasing.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: http://www.cddft.nhs.uk/our-services/community-health-services/community-services/home-equipment-loans.aspx

Code: 468
Partnership Name: Integrated Short Term Intervention Service Multi-Disciplinary Team (ISIS MDT)
Council Name: County Durham and Darlington NHS Foundation Trust (CDDFT)
Region: North East
ONS Code: Other
Lat: #N/A
Long: #N/A
Other Authorities: Durham County Council & County Durham and Darlington NHS Foundation Trust (CDDFT)
Type: Adults

Status: Operational
Website: TBC

Count:

Update Status: Updated for 2015
Code: 468
Partnership Name: Integrated Short Term Intervention Service Multi-Disciplinary Team (ISIS MDT)
Council Name: Durham County Council
Region: North East
ONS Code: E06000047
Lat: 54.69872748
Long: -1.844207506
Other Authorities: Durham County Council & County Durham and Darlington NHS Foundation Trust (CDDFT)
Type: Adults
Description: Integrated Short-term Intervention Service (ISIS) is an important part of Better Care Fund plans, with substantial investment. The service will provide one route into all intermediate care services. The team provides targeted Adult Health and Social Care

Partnership Name: One Point Service- 0-19 Early Help Service for Children, Young People & Families
Council Name: Durham County Council
Region: North East
ONS Code: E06000047
Lat: 54.69417754
Long: -1.84500262
Other Authorities: Durham County Council & County Durham and Darlington NHS Foundation Trust (CDDFT)
Type: Children and Young People
Description: The service aims to meet the following key principles:- Colocation of local authority and health practitioners to deliver effective early help and support for children, young people and their families from the age of 0 to 19 years. The benefits of the service are that duplication is prevented by staff working together in a coordinated way to provide support that will lead to children and young people experiencing good outcomes during their childhood years.

Code: 479
Partnership Name: Digital Durham Programme
Council Name: Darlington Borough Council
Region: North East
ONS Code: E06000005
Lat: 54.55403412
Long: -1.5490275
Other Authorities: Durham County Council, Darlington Council, Gateshead Council, Hartlepool Council, Middlesbrough Council, North Tyneside Council, Redcar and Cleveland Council, Stockton Council, South Tyneside Council, Sunderland Council, Tees Valley Unlimited.
Type: Procurement and Capital Assets
Description: The Programme covers 10 Councils in which broadband provision in certain locations is poor and there is no commitment from the commercial providers to develop their infrastructure. An initial contract has been agreed with BT which allows public subsidy to be used to address some of these locations. The programme is also in the process of procuring a second contract which will address the more difficult locations. The outcome of the programme will result in more premises being able to access fibre based broadband products which will improve life chances, increase GVA etc.
Savings: 100000
Status: Operational
Website: http://www.digitaldurham.org/
Contact: Tony Thompson, Tony.thompson@durham.gov.uk or digital.durham@durham.gov.uk
Placemarker: purple_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: Not Updated for 2015

Partnership Name: Shared Service Arrangement Human Resources, ICT & Legal Services
Council Name: Durham County Council
Region: North East
ONS Code: E06000047
Lat: 54.68873554
Long: -1.83835654
Other Authorities: Durham County Council Northumberland County Council
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: Both councils have required the service areas of Human Resources, ICT and Legal to make a greater percentage of reductions in their budget than those areas providing services directly to the public. The respective Heads of Service in Durham to provide Northumberland with strategic advice and support and to explore the viability of establishing shared service arrangements for each service.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational

Code: 491
Partnership Name: Welfare ReformCounty Durham Triage Assessment
Council Name: Durham County Council
Region: North East
ONS Code: E06000047
Lat: 54.69059565
Long: -1.834367648
Other Authorities: Durham County Council 11 of the largest social landlords operating in County Durham including Dale and Valley Homes Durham City Homes Livin
Type: Shared Services - Customer Facing
Description: The Triage approach was introduced with partners in April 2013 to: Support our Discretionary Housing Payment (DHP) policy to ensure DHP is awarded to those who are in most need Prevent Homelessness; Keep families together; Support the vulnerable in sustaining tenancies; Enable people to secure new sustainable tenancies; Provide financial respite for people in short term difficulty; Encourage people into and maintain work; Provide debt & welfare advice around priority debts. The triage process is operated by Durham County Council Housing Solutions team and our eleven housing provider partners.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Housing Solutions Team - Lyn Hall, Lyn.hall@durham.gov.uk

Partnership Name: North East Combined Authority - Transport
Council Name: Durham County Council
Region: North East
ONS Code: E06000047
Lat: 54.69428867
Long: -1.832340692
Other Authorities: Durham County Council Gateshead Council Newcastle City Council (lead) North Tyneside Council Northumberland County Council South Tyneside Council Sunderland City Council
Type: Environment, Waste and Transport
Description: North East Combined Authority is a new legal body that brings together the seven councils across the North East to create the best possible conditions for growth in jobs, investment and living standards - making the North East an excellent location for business and enabling residents to develop high-level skills so they can benefit long into the future. It is responsible for strategic transport across all 7 local authority areas.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: http://www.northeastca.gov.uk/
Contact: Adrian White or Dave Wafer, Adrian.white@durham.gov.uk or Dave.wafer@durham.gov.uk

Code: 496
Partnership Name: Durham Key Options
Council Name: Durham County Council
Region: North East
ONS Code: E06000047
Lat: 54.69796742
Long: -1.842891039
Other Authorities: Durham County Council Housing Providers Cestria Derwentside Homes Livin Durham City Homes Dale and Valley Homes East Durham Homes, Teesdale Housing Association Accent Foundation
Type: Housing
Description: Durham Key Options is a choice-based lettings scheme that in partnership allocates properties. This partnership of housing providers gives the customer greater choice and say in where they live across the county. Through the scheme, properties are advertised and applicants choose where they wish to live by expressing an interest in a property.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: http://www.durhamkeyoptions.co.uk/Data/ASPPages/1/30.aspx

Code: 13
Partnership Name: West London Alliance - Transport Efficiencies Programme
Council Name: Barnet London Borough Council
Region: London
ONS Code: E09000003
Lat: 51.61076777
Long: -0.204427929
Other Authorities: London Borough of Barnet, London Borough of Brent, London Borough of Ealing, London Borough of Harrow, London Borough of Hounslow
Type: Environment, Waste and Transport
Description: West London Transport Efficiencies Programme aims to establish a new Regional Transport Bureau to improve and deliver efficiencies within current council based transport services. It includes a new regional Transport Bureau , out of borough route sharing, private hire framework, concessionary travel, future vehicle procurement, eligibility and alternative travel.
Savings: 8300000
Status: In Development
Website: www.westlondonalliance.org
Contact: Lance Douglas, WLA Assistant Director, lance.douglas@brent.gov.uk.

Status: In Development
Website: www.westlondonhousing.org.uk/
Contact: Rachel Ormerod, London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham, Rachel Ormerod rachel.ormerod@London Borough of hf.gov.uk

Type: Children and Young People
Description: This programme collaborates across East London on a broad range of children and young peoples services such as fostering & adoption, schools services, inclusive support, early intervention and families, EDT, transitions and joint procurements & appointments. Operational benefits include co-ordinating need, service resilience, innovation and service improvement, improved support and better meeting & understanding of needs.
Savings: 7000000
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Kimberly Sharpe, London Borough of Havering, Kimberley.sharpe@havering.gov.uk

Council Name: Waltham Forest London Borough Council
Region: London
ONS Code: E09000031
Lat: 51.5924673
Long: -0.00501363
Other Authorities: London Borough of Barking & Dagenham, London Borough of Havering, London Borough of Newham, London Borough of Redbrige, Tower Hamlets London Borough, Waltham Forest London Borough
Type: Children and Young People
Description: This programme collaborates across East London on a broad range of children and young peoples services such as fostering & adoption, schools services, inclusive support, early intervention and families, EDT, transitions and joint procurements & appointments. Operational benefits include co-ordinating need, service resilience, innovation and service improvement, improved support and better meeting & understanding of needs.
Savings: 7000000
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Kimberly Sharpe, London Borough of Havering, Kimberley.sharpe@havering.gov.uk

Code: 153
Partnership Name: Newham and Havering Shared ICT Service
Council Name: Havering London Borough Council
Region: London
ONS Code: E09000016
Lat: 51.56153886
Long: 0.228087811
Other Authorities: London Borough of Newham, London Borough of Havering
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: The two councils established a shared service under a single head of service in late 2009. The savings have arisen from lower staff and infrastructure costs. The focus has been equally applied to ICT service and Infrastructure improvement. This allows greater productivity across the organisation and has paved the way for full back office service sharing planned in 2014/15.
Savings: 9000000
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Geoff Connell, Joint Head of ICT, Geoff.connell@newham.gov.uk

Partnership Name: West London Alliance - procurement programme and hub
Council Name: Barnet London Borough Council
Region: London
ONS Code: E09000003
Lat: 51.62098846
Long: -0.206427029
Other Authorities: London Borough of Ealing, London Borough of Barnet, London Borough of Brent, London Borough of Harrow, London Borough of Hounslow, London Borough of Hillingdon and Tri- Boroughs - London Borough of Westminster, London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham, London Borough of Kensington & Chelsea
Type: Environment, Waste and Transport
Description: Set up in early 2012, this programme was established to develop collaborative procurement strategies and initiatives, realising better efficiency savings and service improvements within West London boroughs. Benefits of the shared strategies can be seen in improved market management and commercial awareness, shared learning, and using procurement to drive efficiencies, improvements and savings.
Savings: 15000000
Status: Operational
Website: www.westlondonalliance.org

Region: London
ONS Code: E09000024
Lat: 51.41241402
Long: -0.190485613
Other Authorities: London Borough of Merton and London Borough of Richmond upon Thames.
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: Since Autumn 2011 the London Borough of merton and the London Borough of Richmond upon Thames have established a shared legal service, based in Merton. Service benefits have included large cost savings, greater resilience, transparency of legal costs, and increased client satisfaction. Video conferencing has been introduced to reduce costs in travelling time saving approx�400 per conference. There are ongoing discussions to extend this shared service with the London Borough of Sutton and the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames.
Savings: 500000
Status: Operational

Code: 230
Partnership Name: Internal Audit and Investigations Service
Council Name: Kingston upon Thames Royal Borough Council
Region: London
ONS Code: E09000021
Lat: 51.39283629
Long: -0.283344125
Other Authorities: Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames and London Borough of Richmond upon Thames
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: Richmond and Kingston London Boroughs established a shared Internal Audit and Investigations service that went live in June 2012. Richmond delivers annual audit plans in each authority, the management support and advice and proactive fraud work, reactive corporate fraud investigations, housing fraud and benefit fraud investigations. A future aim for the service is to include other boroughs in the South London Partnership Area or in selling services to external bodies to generate further savings.
Savings: 170000
Status: Operational
Website: www.richmond.gov.uk/internal_audit_service

Code: 348
Partnership Name: Public Law Partnership (PLP)
Council Name: Barking and Dagenham London Borough Council
Region: London
ONS Code: E09000002
Lat: 51.54262953
Long: 0.13024028
Other Authorities: Basildon Borough Council, Braintree District Council, Brentwood Borough Council, Broxbourne Borough Council, Castle Point Borough Council, Cambridge City Council, Chelmsford City Council, Colchester Borough Council, Dacorum Borough Council, East Hertfordshire District Council, Epping Forest District Council, Essex County Council, Essex County Fire & Rescue Services, Harlow District Council, Hertfordshire County Council, Hertsmere Borough Council, Lee Valley Regional Park Authority, Maldon District Council, North Hertfordshire District Council, Rochford District Council, St Albans City & District Council, South Cambridgeshire District Council, Southend-on-Sea Borough Council, Stevenage Borough Council, Suffolk County Council, Tendring District Council, Three Rivers District Council, Thurrock Borough Council and London Borough of Barking and Dagenham, Uttlesford District Council, Watford Borough Council, Welwyn Hatfield Borough Council
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: PLP is a federated partnership of 31 authorities, across four counties in the east of England. It operates an internal market with partners undertaking work for each other at a discounted rate, reducing spend on more costly external legal provision. Procurement of law libraries is undertaken collectively to leverage volume discounts, and training is provided to the workforce, building professional expertise at minimal cost. There is annual benchmarking providing comparative data for all, along with information to identify new projects to achieve further efficiencies and additional income. Since inception in 2008-9, PLP has saved the public purse almost �5m.
Savings: 4954000
Status: Operational
Website: www.publiclawpartnership.co.uk
Contact: Enid_Allen@hotmail.com
Placemarker: ltblu_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: Updated for 2015

Type: Shared Services - Back office

Partnership Name: Southwark and Lambeth joint approach to public health
Council Name: Lambeth London Borough Council
Region: London
ONS Code: E09000022
Lat: 51.45248546
Long: -0.121300103
Other Authorities: Southwark Council, Southwark CCG, SE London CSU Lambeth Council, Lambeth CCG
Type: Adults
Description: Southwark and Lambeth Councils decided to establish a joint public health team across the two boroughs in July 2012. The approach aims to look at public health challenges across both areas, and bring together expertise and resources to common public health challenges, including health inequalities, sexual health, smoking, drugs and alcohol.

Partnership Name: Legal Shared Business Manager
Council Name: Lambeth London Borough Council
Region: London
ONS Code: E09000022
Lat: 51.45061966
Long: -0.118960352
Other Authorities: London Borough of Lambeth London Borough of Southwark
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: In 2011, we agreed with Lambeth to share their Business Manager to develop and support our Business Support Team. The Business manager is seconded to Southwark 2 days a week, the arrangement will continue until 2014. The Business Manager brought considerable experience of managing a Business Support function and IT systems for in-house legal departments. We have benefitted significantly from their IT experience and systems development expertise. The Business manager also managers the Shared Barristers Contract.
Savings: 400000
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided

Code: 437
Partnership Name: oneSource
Council Name: Havering London Borough Council
Region: London
ONS Code: E09000016
Lat: 51.55992562
Long: 0.21982821
Other Authorities: London Borough of Havering London Borough of Newham
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: Havering and Newham councils have brought together 21 separate support services, including HR, payroll, ICT, legal services and asset management, and 1,350 staff together into a new single shared service called oneSource. Setting up oneSource will allow the two councils to save over �40million in the next five years with the savings being used to protect both councils' frontline services for residents.The new shared service is: Increasing operational efficiency, Reducing the costs of support services, Providing resilience and flexibility, Building on best practice service delivery, Making savings through common procurement strategies and sharing expertise. The two councils see oneSource as a model for public sector shared services in the future and hope to gain more customers in all types of public service.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: www.onesource.co.uk
Contact: Tony Huff, tony.huff@onesource.co.uk
Placemarker: ltblu_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: Not Updated for 2015

Code: 1
Partnership Name: Essex Online Partnership
Council Name: Basildon District Council
Region: East of England
ONS Code: E07000066
Lat: 51.58856233
Long: 0.473984247
Other Authorities: Essex County Council, Southend Borough Council, Thurrock District Council, Basildon Borough Council, Braintree District Council, Brentwood Borough Council, Castle Point District Council, Chelmsford Borough Council, Colchester Borough Council, Harlow Council, Maldon District Council, Rochford District Council, Tendring District Council, Uttlesford District Council, Essex Police and Essex Fire and Rescue,
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: EOLP is a partnership of 16 public authorities in the Essex area, including: District Councils, County Council, Unitary Councils, Fire and Rescue Service and Police Service. The purpose of the partnership is to share knowledge, resource and services to provide technology solutions which support the business needs of each partner organisation and reduce the cost of their technology. How our citizens conduct their business with us is continually evolving, and the partnership is prime placed in helping organisations to understand and adapt their services to ensure they continue to meet customer needs. Pressures to reduce the cost of services that we deliver are key drivers, reinforcing the value and importance of a large partnership working together. The partnership can reduce the cost of technology and by using that technology reduce the cost of services that are delivered.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Kim Karacolak, kim.karacolak@essex.co.uk
Placemarker: ltblu_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: Not Updated for 2015

Contact: Kim Karacolak, kim.karacolak@essex.co.uk
Placemarker: ltblu_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: Not Updated for 2015
Code: 1
Partnership Name: Essex Online Partnership
Council Name: Chelmsford Borough Council
Region: East of England
ONS Code: E07000070
Lat: 51.72007098
Long: 0.478521375
Other Authorities: Essex County Council, Southend Borough Council, Thurrock District Council, Basildon Borough Council, Braintree District Council, Brentwood Borough Council, Castle Point District Council, Chelmsford Borough Council, Colchester Borough Council, Harlow Council, Maldon District Council, Rochford District Council, Tendring District Council, Uttlesford District Council, Essex Police and Essex Fire and Rescue,
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: EOLP is a partnership of 16 public authorities in the Essex area, including: District Councils, County Council, Unitary Councils, Fire and Rescue Service and Police Service. The purpose of the partnership is to share knowledge, resource and services to provide technology solutions which support the business needs of each partner organisation and reduce the cost of their technology. How our citizens conduct their business with us is continually evolving, and the partnership is prime placed in helping organisations to understand and adapt their services to ensure they continue to meet customer needs. Pressures to reduce the cost of services that we deliver are key drivers, reinforcing the value and importance of a large partnership working together. The partnership can reduce the cost of technology and by using that technology reduce the cost of services that are delivered.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Kim Karacolak, kim.karacolak@essex.co.uk

Update Status: Not Updated for 2015
Code: 11
Partnership Name: Joint Procurement of ICT Contract
Council Name: Braintree District Council
Region: East of England
ONS Code: E07000067
Lat: 51.94747996
Long: 0.593867387
Other Authorities: Braintree District Council, Castle Point Borough Council, Colchester Borough Council, Rochford District Council
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: Partnership formed to procure high quality, low cost ICT services aimed at achieving: The creation and implementation of an innovative approach to IT, a shared approach to IT delivery, significant economies of scale by contracting with the same IT supplier, initial realisation of a proportion of targeted savings for £7m overall and £1.7m for Braintree DC specifically over the next five years, a significant reduction in the cost of procurement and in the duplication of effort.
Savings: 4200000
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Cherie Root, cherie.root@braintree.gov.uk
Placemarker: ltblu_stars

col17:

Placemarker: ltblu_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: Not Updated for 2015
Code: 15
Partnership Name: Joint Urban Design Team
Council Name: Cambridge City Council
Region: East of England
ONS Code: E07000008
Lat: 52.20155228
Long: 0.130054433
Other Authorities: Cambridge City Council, South Cambridgeshire District Council
Type: Shared Services - Customer Facing
Description: Shared service for the planning and design of major development sites in the Cambridge city and district area. The team is currently led by a head of service at the city council with members of the team seconded for a fixed period into the joint team. The team provides design advice and guidance to developers and land use planners, as well as formulates strategies for most of the major development sites.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Glen Richardson, Cambridge City Council, glen.richardson@cambridge.gov.uk
Placemarker: red_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: Not Updated for 2015
Code: 15
Partnership Name: Joint Urban Design Team
Council Name: South Cambridgeshire District Council
Region: East of England
ONS Code: E07000012
Lat: 52.17497105
Long: 0.07842431
Other Authorities: Cambridge City Council, South Cambridgeshire District Council
Type: Shared Services - Customer Facing
Description: Shared service for the planning and design of major development sites in the Cambridge city and district area. The team is currently led by a head of service at the city council with members of the team seconded for a fixed period into the joint team. The team provides design advice and guidance to developers and land use planners, as well as formulates strategies for most of the major development sites.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Glen Richardson, Cambridge City Council, glen.richardson@cambridge.gov.uk

Other Authorities: Cambridgeshire County Council, South Cambridgeshire District Council, Huntingdonshire District Council, Fenland District Council, Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Fire and Rescue, Bedfordshire Fire and Rescue, Cambridgeshire Voluntary and Community Sector represented by CAB,
Type: Procurement and Capital Assets
Description: Cambridgeshire Public Sector Network is a shared services contract for provision of a communications network and associated services. It provides Wide and Local Area Networks, Telephony and Security Infrastructure Services. The procurement phase now completed and implementation is underway. Shared service and contract management function due to be implemented from April 2012.

Code: 45
Partnership Name: Essex Public Law Partnership
Council Name: Basildon District Council
Region: East of England
ONS Code: E07000066
Lat: 51.59261508
Long: 0.473150682
Other Authorities: Braintree District Council, Brentwood Borough Council, Basildon District Council, Castle Point Borough Council, Chelmsford Borough Council, Colchester Borough Council, Harlow District Council, Maldon District Council, Rochford Borough Council, Uttlesford District Council, Southend-on-Sea Borough Council, Thurrock Council , Essex County Council
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: Essex Legal Services Partnership has created a new model for local government services, which enables the teams to improve services to clients and communities. The new way of working provides a virtual team approach with each council maintaining its own legal experts yet pooling resources to meet client needs through an Internal Market Place, reducing costs from sharing and from joint approaches to procurement.
Savings: 400000
Status: Operational
Website: www.vinehr.co.uk
Contact: Alison Anderson, Essex County Council, alison.anderson@essex.gov.uk

Lat: 51.71864961

Other Authorities: Braintree District Council, Brentwood Borough Council, Basildon District Council, Castle Point Borough Council, Chelmsford Borough Council, Colchester Borough Council, Harlow District Council, Maldon District Council, Rochford Borough Council, Uttlesford District Council, Southend-on-Sea Borough Council, Thurrock Council , Essex County Council
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: Essex Legal Services Partnership has created a new model for local government services, which enables the teams to improve services to clients and communities. The new way of working provides a 'virtual' team approach with each council maintaining its own legal experts yet pooling resources to meet client needs through an Internal Market Place, reducing costs from sharing and from joint approaches to procurement.
Savings: 400000
Status: Operational
Website: www.vinehr.co.uk
Contact: Alison Anderson, Essex County Council, alison.anderson@essex.gov.uk

Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: The path-finding Asset Management project is taking place in Essex and has 17 participants involving all local authorities, the Fire Service and Essex Constabulary. The project will enable the participants to identify business cases, which will feature asset sharing, rationalisation opportunities, improved service delivery and co-location possibilities, amongst others.

Status: Operational

Partnership Name: Essex Procurement Partnership - The Procurement Agency for Essex (PAE)
Council Name: Basildon District Council
Region: East of England
ONS Code: E07000066
Lat: 51.59487132
Long: 0.466058197
Other Authorities: Basildon District Council, Braintree District Council, Brentwood Borough Council, Castle Point Borough Council, Chelmsford Borough Council, Colchester Borough Council, Essex County Council, Essex County Fire and Rescue Service, Epping Forest District Council, Greenfields Community Housing, Harlow Council, Maldon District Council, Rochford District Council, Southend-on-Sea Borough Council, St Georges Community Housing, Tendring District Council, Thurrock Council, Uttlesford District Council
Type: Procurement and Capital Assets
Description: The Procurement Agency for Essex was established in April 2004 to promote and facilitate collaborative procurement across Essex. The Agency provides the following services: Managing projects to bring about a range of better procurement outcomes, sharing procurement best practice, knowledge, information, documentation and capacity, Providing training and procurement related commercial support, Promoting & maintaining high procurement standards across Essex
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Chanry Liu Harlow District Council, chanry.liu@harlow.gcsx.gov.uk

Partnership Name: Shared Revenue Partnership (including counter Fraud)
Council Name: Babergh District Council
Region: East of England
ONS Code: E07000200
Lat: 52.04928722
Long: 0.912727821
Other Authorities: Babergh District Council, Mid Suffolk District Council, Ipswich Borough Council
Type: Shared Services - Customer Facing
Description: The provision of a joint Revenues and Benefits service hosted at Ipswich. Currently expanding home working to reduce accommodation costs further. Option to add 4th partner at a later date. Excludes Customer Services, but includes a counter fraud partnership. Reports to a joint committee made up of councillors and senior officers.
Savings: 3202000
Status: Operational
Website: No web address provided
Contact: Evelyn Crossland Ipswich Borough Council, evelyn.crossland@ipswich.gov.uk

Count:
col17:
Update Status: Not Updated for 2015
Code: 89
Partnership Name: nplaw (Norfolk Public Law)
Council Name: Broadland District Council
Region: East of England
ONS Code: E07000144
Lat: 52.69812531
Long: 1.310198289
Other Authorities: Norfolk County Council, Great Yarmouth Borough Council, Norwich City Council, Broadland District Council, Broads Authority
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: nplaw (Norfolk Public Law) is a shared legal service, launched 1 October 2010. Hosted by Norfolk County Council, nplaw is able to deliver a full range of public sector legal services and offers local authority and other public sector clients a professional, customer-focused service at affordable rates. nplaw provides legal services for a large number of authorities in Norfolk and across England and Wales. The chosen model of collaborative working will assist in minimising costs, sharing knowledge and expertise, improving career development opportunities and delivering a high level of client satisfaction.
Savings: 100000
Status: Operational
Website: http://www.rfolk.gov.uk/Business/nplaw/index.htm
Contact: Victoria McNeill, Norfolk County Council, victoria.mcneill@norfolk.gov.uk
Placemarker: ltblu_stars
Count:
col17:
Update Status: Not Updated for 2015

Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: nplaw (Norfolk Public Law) is a shared legal service, launched 1 October 2010. Hosted by Norfolk County Council, nplaw is able to deliver a full range of public sector legal services and offers local authority and other public sector clients a professional, customer-focused service at affordable rates. nplaw provides legal services for a large number of authorities in Norfolk and across England and Wales. The chosen model of collaborative working will assist in minimising costs, sharing knowledge and expertise, improving career development opportunities and delivering a high level of client satisfaction.
Savings: 100000
Status: Operational
Website: http://www.rfolk.gov.uk/Business/nplaw/index.htm
Contact: Victoria McNeill, Norfolk County Council, victoria.mcneill@norfolk.gov.uk

Code: 98
Partnership Name: LGSS
Council Name: Cambridgeshire County Council
Region: East of England
ONS Code: E10000003
Lat: 52.33828611
Long: 0.030767101
Other Authorities: Cambridgeshire County Council, Huntingdonshire District Council, Northamptonshire County Council, Northampton Borough Council and Norwich City Council
Type: Shared Services - Back office
Description: Established in October 2010 and owned by Cambridgeshire and Northamptonshire County Councils, LGSS is one of the UK�s largest shared services ventures, employing over 1300 staff. Operating with a business ethos of �by the public sector, for the public sector� LGSS aim to deliver savings and efficiencies for all our public sector customers based on a shared risk/reward service delivery model. LGSS deliver a wide range of professional and transactional services to local authorities and other public sector organisations. These include Finance, Audit, Risk and Insurance, HR, IT, Property Asset Management and Legal services. Working together with customers, LGSS aim to provide the services they need to operate as effectively and efficiently as possible.
Savings: 9772000
Status: Operational
Website: www.lgss.co.uk
Contact: camgamble@northamptonshire.gov.uk

Partnership Name: East Suffolk Shared Services

ONS Code: E07000205
Lat: 52.15961195

Type: Shared Management and Shared CEX
Description: The two councils are either already providing a shared service or have plans in place to do so for the vast majority of support and front line services. The councils share a Chief Executive. Financial savings are helping to deliver medium term financial plans, improved methods of working, joint ICT infrastructure providing opportunities for further transformation, flexible working.

Code: 142
Partnership Name: Anglia Revenues Partnership
Council Name: Breckland Council
Region: East of England
ONS Code: E07000143
Lat: 52.58485451
Long: 0.83679653
Other Authorities: Breckland District Council, East Cambridgeshire District Council, Forest Heath District Council, St Edmundsbury Borough Council, with 3 additional councils joining from April 2014 - Waveney District Council, Suffolk Coastal District Council and Fenland District Council.
Type: Shared Services - Customer Facing
Description: Anglia Revenues Partnership is a group of 5 councils providing a shared Revenues & Benefits services with Waveney and Suffolk Coastal District Councils also working in partnership through a Section 113 agreement. Created in 2003 the Partnership has provided significant improvements in service delivery & annual financial savings from reduced IT costs, shared management, specialist staffing and training. in excess of�1.75 Million rising to�2million for year 2012/13. Operational benefits include reduced benefit processing times, improved customer satisfaction and collection rates.
Savings: 0
Status: Operational
Website: http://www.angliarevenues.gov.uk/
Contact: Paul Corney, Head of ARP, Anglia Revenues Partnership, paul.corney@angliarevenues.gov.uk
